instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
i just working on that board.

it had a bit liquid near smc and <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>

no green light no fan spin

i found <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on F7040 is 12.22V so smc not working

i found 3 bad resistors <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5076</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR> after replacing I get 12.54V and a green light, so that is ok, fan is spinning

no sound no video no Voltage on L7550 and 7560

i found that duke wrote in the forum there is only power after initalizing the gpu. if i understand right it means problem with initalising gpu.

L8930/60 has 0.91V (both pin2)

is it possible that the bios is not working? on wich point the bios is loaded?

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
forgot, Y8700 has a nice waveform 27Mhz on Pin 1 and Pin 3

i just swaped the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> from a good board but not better, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> is 3.3V

I checked the caps above the gpu both ends all reading in diode mode about 0.340

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Probably crap under the SMC as liquid was right next to it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: thanks, so would you suggest to lift and reball it or at first try to ultrclean it?

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
i just reballed the smc, looked not nasty under it.

now i have still no Voltage on L7550 and 7560

but L7510/20/30 was before reballing about 1.0 - 1.12V, now is about 0.92,

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
i connected the board to an lcd and... it works.

so duke, no Voltage on L7550 and 7560 before initialising the lcd?

so i think the solution was to reball the smc like duke suggested. after that changed the voltage on L7510/20/30

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
i tested the board now in the machine and still found a coroded j6955 after replacing, that was not easy, the board say no audio device found

before replacing J6955 audio and mic was working good.

what could here happend? need still help please.

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: where to start here, wich area is the first unit for audio ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]power on problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Ok, solved, audio is back, missing L6200 :-)
